articles.title: Aldilas Achmad Nursetyo
articles.contents:
dr. Aldilas AN, M.Sc.

              Aldilas Achmad Nursetyo

            Bio
            Since 2017, Aldilas has been actively involved in contribute and developing at national and regional level, either academically or direct consultancy. He has experience in developing monitoring and evaluation system in National Family Planning Coordinating Agency (BKKBN) and strengthening national disease surveillance system, especially for early warning and response system (EWARS). He also experienced in research methodology, either quantitative or qualitative methodology, while demonstrating excelence scientific writing and publication experience.
            
            
            Education
            Taipei Medical University | Taipei, TW
            M.Sc. (Biomedical Informatics) | September 2017 - August 2019
            Universitas Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta | Yogyakarta, ID
            B.Sc. in Medicine & M.D. (Medical Doctor) | September 2007 - February 2015
            
            
            Experience
            Center for Health Policy & Management, UGM | Researcher | January 2020 - Present
            International Center for Health Information Technology, TMU | Research Scientist | January 2018 - August 2019
            
            
            Publication
            Prediction of Clinical Events in Hemodialysis Patients Using an Artificial Neural Network link
            Virtual reality among the elderly: a usefulness and acceptance study from Taiwan link
            Graft Rejection Prediction Following Kidney Transplantation Using Machine Learning Techniques: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis link
            Artificial-Intelligence-Based Prediction of Clinical Events among Hemodialysis Patients Using Non-Contact Sensor Data link
            Roles of Sedentary Behaviors and Unhealthy Foods in Increasing the Obesity Risk in Adult Men and Women: A Cross-Sectional National Study link
            Virtual Reality for Active Ageing: A feasibility study in Taiwan (APAMI 2018)
            Roles of Sedentary Behaviors and Unhealthy Foods in Increasing the Obesity Risk in Adult Men and Women: A Cross-Sectional National Study link
            Mobile and Wearable Technologies in Healthcare for the Ageing Population link
